Package ooga.controller

Interface FrontEndExternalAPI

All Known Implementing Classes:
ViewController
public interface FrontEndExternalAPI
Classes that implement this interface are meant to be passed around the back end in order to call the appropriate methods on the front end

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void gameLose​(java.lang.String playerName)
    Called when the game is done and a player has lost
    void gameWin​(java.lang.String playerName)
    Called when the game is done and a player has won
    void setBoardDimensions​(int width, int height)
    Sets the board dimensions that should be displayed
    void setBoardSpace​(int row, int column, java.lang.String identifier)
    Sets a specific board space to a certain object
    void setModelController​(BackEndExternalAPI modelController)
    Links this half of the controller to the other half that is passed around the front end
    void setPlayer​(int playerNumber, java.lang.String playerName)
    Sets a player that is playing the game

  • Method Details

    • setModelController

      void setModelController​(BackEndExternalAPI modelController)
      Links this half of the controller to the other half that is passed around the front end
      Parameters:
      modelController - The other half of the controller

    • setBoardDimensions

      void setBoardDimensions​(int width, int height)
      Sets the board dimensions that should be displayed
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the board
      height - The height of the board

    • setBoardSpace

      void setBoardSpace​(int row, int column, java.lang.String identifier)
      Sets a specific board space to a certain object
      Parameters:
      row - The row of the space
      column - The column of the space
      identifier - The identifier of the piece

    • gameWin

      void gameWin​(java.lang.String playerName)
      Called when the game is done and a player has won
      Parameters:
      playerName - The name of the winning player

    • gameLose

      void gameLose​(java.lang.String playerName)
      Called when the game is done and a player has lost
      Parameters:
      playerName - The name of the losing player

    • setPlayer

      void setPlayer​(int playerNumber, java.lang.String playerName)
      Sets a player that is playing the game
      Parameters:
      playerNumber - The number of the player so it can be kept track of
      playerName - The name of the player
